ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
October 17, 2025
Alexander Fedorowych
Heartland Lansing
1909 Tahoe Cir,
Okemos, MI, 48864-2770
Re: License #: CM331002833
Dear Alexander Fedorowych:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 10/13/2025. The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Samantha Way at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Cathrine Raftery, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• The facility should make sure that dates are noted within the reference letters
they receive for new hires. This will make it easier to verify that the reference was
obtained prior to the staff member being hired.

• If the facility pursues to obtain a contract with MDHHS or for a crisis stabilization
contract, the facility will need to obtain their program statement and policies to
reflect the changes within these contracts. The facility should not take placement
of one of these youth prior to their updated program statement and policies being
approved by state licensing consultant to ensure compliance with the rule set.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Financial Overview
The facility completed their 2025/ 2026 yearly budget which shows the facility to be
in positive standing. The 2025 financial audit will be completed by the first of June
2026. This will be reflected within the 2026 interim audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable
Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief Administrator assessment report was received on 9/30/2025. Within the
assessment report, Chief Administrator states the facility has been maintaining
compliance of the rules and Public Act 116. This statement is evidenced by the
facility not having any open corrective action plans during the period under review.
Chief Administrator reports the facility will continue to conduct quarterly reviews of
all policies and procedures to ensure compliance with all licensing rules and
regulations. The facility will continue to remain in contact with referral sources of
any policy changes and utilize this consultant during quarterly reviews to maintain
compliance. The facility plans to continue to partner with their local children's

hospital in the event any youth is in need of a mental health evaluation due to
mental health concerns.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews were conducted during the inspection and staff noted they truly
enjoy their job. Staff reported they feel supported by the whole administrative team
and feels they have been trained in tools to make them successful within their
jobs. The staff did not report any safety concerns to this consultant.
Three youth were interviewed during the inspection. All three youth reported
feeling safe at the facility and have enjoyed their time at the facility. The youth did
not report any safety concerns to this consultant. One of the youth reported she
really enjoys this facility because it is in an actual house that is located in a local
neighborhood and reported this makes her feel she is making positive steps to be
placed back into her home with family.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An onsite inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on October 13, 2025.
There were no issues or safety concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
October 15, 2025
___________________________________________
Cathrine Raftery Date
Licensing Consultant
